column4: I'd like to perform a screen session at auto start. Tried using crontab and inserted a line '@reboot screen -S rtorrent rtorrent', but it seemed to fail, without even a msg in dmesg (other @reboot commands in crontab do work). Has anyone got a suggestion on howto fix/workaround this?
spawn it from rc.local  as a proper user. with  use of the su command and its options.
can you give a bit more information on howto do that? where can I find rc.local
ive never seen that used in crontab befor.. :)  @reboot
how can i spawn it as a proper user in the rc.local file?
with theuse of the 'su' command.  unless you want it running as root.
that may be why it was having problems befor.?
could be, so this will work in rc.local ?: "su - user screen -S rtorrent rtorrent"
try it and see i guess.   you checked the su man pages? :)
yes i did, but using this command requires a password prompt it seems could find a way around it in the man pages
from the rc.local it gets ran as root.
no it's fhuizing so the command will be: "su - fhuizing screen -S rtorrent rtorrent"
you might want toreread the man pages.. i think you need the -C option in there somewhere.
and that implies no pw prompt?
the rc.localis ran by root anyway. he can su to a user with out needing a password   I think
